title: MBE macro with struct body argument breaks proc macro derive
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
macro_rules! mbe_macro {
	($decl: tt) => {
		use encde::Encode;
		#[derive(Encode)]
		struct Struct $decl
	};
}

mbe_macro!({
	a: u8,
	b: u8,
	c: u8,
});
```

I used `cargo-expand` to expand the macros and got the following result:

```rust
#![feature(prelude_import)]
#[prelude_import]
use std::prelude::rust_2021::*;
#[macro_use]
extern crate std;
use encde::Encode;
struct Struct {
    a: u8,
    b: u8,
    c: u8,
}
impl ::encde::Encode for Struct {
    fn encode(&self, writer: &mut dyn std::io::Write) -> ::encde::Result<()> {
        ::encde::Encode::encode(&self.a, writer)?;
        ::encde::Encode::encode(&self.b, writer)?;
        ::encde::Encode::encode(&self.c, writer)?;
        Ok(())
    }
}
```

And this compiles. However, attempting to compile the unexpanded source gives the following error:

```
error[E0425]: cannot find value `writer` in this scope
  --> derive_test/src/lib.rs:47:2
   |
47 |     a: u8,
   |     ^^^^^ not found in this scope
error[E0425]: cannot find value `writer` in this scope
  --> derive_test/src/lib.rs:48:2
   |
48 |     b: u8,
   |     ^^^^^ not found in this scope
error[E0425]: cannot find value `writer` in this scope
  --> derive_test/src/lib.rs:49:2
   |
49 |     c: u8,
   |     ^^^^^ not found in this scope
For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`.
```

### Meta

I can share the source of the procedural macro if necessary but, based on the macro expansion, I can't see what I could do different.
